body:
**What happened**:

In a dual-stack cluster when specifying both ipv6 and ipv4 addresses in the `nodePortAddresses` entries are inserted in ipvs for the ipv6 nodeports but with an invalid ipv4 address;

```
$ grep nodePortAddresses /etc/kubernetes/kube-proxy.config 
nodePortAddresses: ["::1/128","127.0.0.1/32"]
$ ipvsadm -Ln
IP Virtual Server version 1.2.1 (size=4096)
Prot LocalAddress:Port Scheduler Flags
  -> RemoteAddress:Port           Forward Weight ActiveConn InActConn
TCP  12.0.0.1:443 rr
  -> 192.168.1.1:6443             Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  12.0.132.28:5001 rr
  -> 11.0.0.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.1.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.2.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.3.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  12.0.156.179:443 rr
  -> 11.0.0.3:4443                Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  127.0.0.1:30100 rr
  -> 11.0.0.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.1.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.2.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.3.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  127.0.0.1:30200 rr   # <---------- WRONG ENTRY!
  -> 17.0.0.0:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  [fd00:4000::27c7]:5001 rr
  -> [1100::2]:5001               Masq    1      0          0         
  -> [1100:0:0:1::2]:5001         Masq    1      0          0         
  -> [1100:0:0:2::2]:5001         Masq    1      0          0         
  -> [1100:0:0:3::2]:5001         Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  [::1]:30200 rr
  -> [1100::2]:5001               Masq    1      0          0         
  -> [1100:0:0:1::2]:5001         Masq    1      0          0         
  -> [1100:0:0:2::2]:5001         Masq    1      0          0         
  -> [1100:0:0:3::2]:5001         Masq    1      0          0         
```

The example shows the ipv4 loopback address but any ipv4 address in `nodePortAddresses` will cause a faulty entry.

**What you expected to happen**:

No ipv4 entry shall be inserted for the ipv6 nodeport.


**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

* Configure `nodePortAddresses` with both ipv4 and ipv6 addresses
* Bring up a dual-stack cluster with proxy-mode `ipvs`
* Create a service with ipFamily:IPv6
* Do `ipvsadm -Ln`


**Anything else we need to know?**:

Proxy-mode=iptables seems to work.

With `nodePortAddresses: nil` no ipv4 entries are inserted for ipv6 nodeports.

In https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#nodeport it is recommended to use `127.0.0.0/8` but doing so makes kube-proxy enter rules for address `127.0.0.0` (in addition to "127.0.0.1"). While these entries cause no harm they can't be used and should not be there. These entries are created for both proxy-mode "iptables" and "ipvs". This should not be handled in this issue but in another (new) issue if needed. Example;

```
$ ipvsadm -Ln
TCP  127.0.0.0:30100 rr
  -> 11.0.0.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.1.3:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.2.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
  -> 11.0.3.2:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
TCP  127.0.0.0:30200 rr
  -> 17.0.0.0:5001                Masq    1      0          0         
(narrowed)
```


**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"19+", GitVersion:"v1.19.0-alpha.1.382+38f0a8bc74bed9", GitCommit:"38f0a8bc74bed92bef87e20a79c36c5feea78b3d", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-04-07T08:36:57Z", GoVersion:"go1.14", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"19+", GitVersion:"v1.19.0-alpha.1.382+38f0a8bc74bed9", GitCommit:"38f0a8bc74bed92bef87e20a79c36c5feea78b3d", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-04-07T08:36:33Z", GoVersion:"go1.14", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Kvm's on Ubuntu
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): xcluster
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
Linux vm-002 5.6.0 #6 SMP Sun Apr 5 08:35:14 CEST 2020 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
- Install tools: "from scratch"
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug): calico/cni:v3.12.0
- Others:


/sig network

labels.name: kind/bug

title: DualStack: Kube-proxy/ipvs; nodePortAddresses with both ipv6 and ipv4 causes invalid ipvs entries
